title: Analyze your matches with Echo!

embed.description: Want to jump here from any LoL Match Details page? Drag this [ Analyze with Echo] bookmarklet to your bookmarks bar!

body:
Hey, guys!  To try to get better at LoL, I built a match analyzer.  I call it [Echo](http://lolecho.com/).

It has graphs and maps so you can see what was going on at any point during the game.  I use it to see how well I farmed in mid compared to my lane mate, or to figure out why at 23 minutes the enemy jungler started kicking my butt.

There's lots of data; I've improved a lot from using it.  If you want to learn more, there are detailed instructions on the [about page](http://lolecho.com/about/).

For an example match, see [this one](http://lolecho.com/?na:1727670208) or maybe [this nemesis game](http://lolecho.com/?na:1732653804).  Click "Quick Tour" and it'll show you around.

replies.body:
This is really slick! I love it! Gonna dig around and poke at it more to see if I have any useful feedback for you, but at first glance is this pretty cool. I love it when something new comes alive from our Community Developers!

One thing I did notice.. it threw an error saying there was no Match history for my name however, the error where it suggests you check your realm. On a hunch, after that happened I waited a minute or so and tried again and it worked fine. Likely some kind of data caching issue on the first ever lookup of a Summoner name I presume? Might want to see about adding in a custom return for those scenarios.. but nothing critical.

I'm glad you like it!  I look forward to any feedback you or your fellow Rioters have.  It took a while to build, but I'm pleased with the result.  I hope other people find it useful.

To prevent stampeding the Riot API, I cache failures (even from network hiccups) for 60 seconds.  As for your lookup failing, it could have been anything from a network hiccup to a temporary API issue.  I'll update the messaging for it.

Tracked down the errors people are seeing.  Sadly, none of them are within my control.  The Riot API is returning 503 (service unavailable) at random, and is also occasionally having issues with connectivity or TLS negotiation.  Hopefully, it's a temporary issue.  I'm well within my API request limit, so it's something on Riot's end.

> [{quoted}](name=topaz2078,realm=NA,application-id=2XjzURgc,discussion-id=9IlRidsH,comment-id=000000010000,timestamp=2015-02-17T04:45:08.597+0000)
>
> Tracked down the errors people are seeing.  Sadly, none of them are within my control.  The Riot API is returning 503 (service unavailable) at random, and is also occasionally having issues with connectivity or TLS negotiation.  Hopefully, it's a temporary issue.  I'm well within my API request limit, so it's something on Riot's end.

Yeah we've covered this a bit in our Dev Forums. TL;DR the 503 is not *your* rate limit being exceeded, but the global Riot API exceeding *its* rate limit in connecting with the Match History servers. We're looking to raise that limit with them in the near future, just finishing a few things first before we do so.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Sargonas,realm=NA,application-id=2XjzURgc,discussion-id=9IlRidsH,comment-id=0000000100000000,timestamp=2015-02-17T07:08:53.418+0000)
>
> Yeah we've covered this a bit in our Dev Forums. TL;DR the 503 is not *your* rate limit being exceeded, but the global Riot API exceeding *its* rate limit in connecting with the Match History servers. We're looking to raise that limit with them in the near future, just finishing a few things first before we do so.

Hey I've got a question regarding 3rd party programs and I'd like someone with actual knowledge of what could actually be a banworthy program and what is riot approved. Think you can help me out here?

Are you wanting insight on something you are making yourself? If so hit us up over on the dev forums at https://developer.riotgames.com/discussion/riot-games-api

If this is about a program you've seen in the wild.. the TL;DR is nothing is "Approved" by Riot. There are a lot of things that we don't care if you use them, but we don't official approve any of them. If you think it is providing ANY advantage at all, odds are it's not ok. If it is also interacting with the game in any impactful way between when you hit "play" and when the end of game screen appears, it's also likely not ok. Does that help?

If you need further advice beyond that, you can feel free to hit up player support and they can give you more insight.

EDIT - WHOOPS there was a rogue "." at the end of the url!

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Sargonas,realm=NA,application-id=2XjzURgc,discussion-id=9IlRidsH,comment-id=000000010000000000000002,timestamp=2015-02-17T19:13:40.878+0000)
>
> Are you wanting insight on something you are making yourself? If so hit us up over on the dev forums at https://developer.riotgames.com/discussion/riot-games-api.

"
404 Not Found
"Poor lost souls"
- Thresh
"

RIP link. lol. I refresh but still same message. Hmmm.....
Whoops! There was a rogue "." at the end of the URL. I removed it in the above post. Just drop that . from the end are you are golden!

omg, how did I not notice that. lol. I remember putting a period at the end of a link before in a different post and it making the period part of the link. Can't believe I didn't catch it doing that on this post. =P

That's pretty straight forward and you don't really need a Rioter to tell you. Anything that gives you an unfair advantage would probably just be a bland answer so I'd advise maybe listing the features this client offers to give you a more complete answer.

We've actually got a whole thread tinkering around on this over in the Dev Forums. The TL;DR is that the match history uses the X-Y cords from the game, and the in-game map is actually a bit larger due to the "off the map" space on the borders in the sky boxes beyond the normal game play area. The map image however is cropped down (and different dimension ratios), so the numbers don't line up. We've been looking at ways to make this less painful for folks but the reality is there is no easy solution, even Match History has to do some magic shenanigans with the numbers to make it look ok, and even then it isn't perfect.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Sargonas,realm=NA,application-id=2XjzURgc,discussion-id=9IlRidsH,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-02-17T03:28:47.581+0000)
>
> One thing I did notice.. it threw an error saying there was no Match history for my name however, the error where it suggests you check your realm. On a hunch, after that happened I waited a minute or so and tried again and it worked fine.

Thought I'd also search myself to see if what you said was true. No error message for me. Could've been a one time weird glitch kind of thing.
Really cool, will be using this more.

Logged in for the first time in forever to upvote and bump this thread.

It's that cool, awesome job Topaz

Edit: One suggestion is that I'd like to have a button to return to the searched history (I'm aware that I could just hit the back button on my browser, it's not an issue, just a suggestion)
Whoa... This is impressive.
I love it!

Useful thingamabob you've got here, helps me form a general idea on some players thought processes/choices.

Props. {{summoner:2}}
This tool is amazing.
Apparently I camp lanes so hard I'm not actually a jungler, rather a bot/mid lanner.

http://www.amazon.com/Coleman-2000007827-Sundome-4-Person-Tent/dp/B004J2GUOU/ref=sr_1_1?s=outdoor-recreation&ie=UTF8&qid=1424378830&sr=1-1&keywords=camping+tent

;)
Oh, so he gets his tent from amazon. One of my friends came across an enemy who got his tent from wal-mart. Which tent is the best tent
This is very well made. Nice job!

I remember a tool that gave some tips below the stats. I think it was an older version of echo.

Did you scrap that, or was it another tool?

There are some typos in the dataset, specifically the first letter of each word in multiwords

Phrases like current-old had me confused for a while.
What browser are you using?  I made a change that might have fixed it.
I'm using Firefox 30 and yes, it is fixed now.
This is good, +1. :3

Is there any way to show the map in smaller time increments?  A lot of stuff can happen in 1 minute once laning phase breaks.

Other than that, the information in this thing is astounding.

Sadly, things like champion positions are only delivered in one-minute granularity, although I do use information about kills to augment that.  Things with higher granularity aren't positional, so they're shown in the timeline graph instead.

That's awesome! Bookmarking.

I noticed something; I looked at a Thresh game I did (http://lolecho.com/?na:1726060741) and I noticed that it doesn't seem to be calculating the armor/AP gains from souls. I'm guessing that might be a little difficult to code for, but I figured you might like to know.

Cheers!
The API doesn't return that information, sadly.  Effects and passives and items with "unique abilities" instead of stats aren't included.
Bummer. Kinda figured as much.

I checked one of my matches and was wonder how in the world we came back.  Then it hit me.  This match shows the power of the 5th dragon.

http://lolecho.com/?na:1726521203
This is awesome. I can pinpoint exactly when a game went south with this! I also enjoy where it shows how many times you and your opponent killed each other.
Any way to make it for normal matches too? I haven't played ranked, but I'm curious to see how well I do when I actually play SR.

You can either use the in-game match history browser in your profile, or use the [official match history webiste](http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/).  Opening details of a match in either of those lists will bring it up in your web browser, at which  point you can hand the match URL to Echo using [the instructions on the Echo about page](http://lolecho.com/about/).

You can use the same method after a normal match, too.  Click the "View Advanced Details" button in the summary screen after a match, then follow the same [steps in the Echo about page](http://lolecho.com/about/).
Thank you very much!
This is really nice to see how one does compared to the rest of the participants. Especially when comparing jungle gold/XP gains to the rest of SR. hint-hint riot

Really nice looking site man, looks like it could be pretty beneficial if you are looking to analyze games.

Keep up the good work its very impressive.
This is great
This is pretty cool, a little fine tuning needed perhaps, but overall pretty neat. My favorite part must've been seeing where everyone was at certain points of the match.

I really like all the work that went into this, it is a very well made program.

(suggestion) Down at the bottom right where it shows champions builds and stats, I think it would be better to swap the AR with the AP so that both damage stats and both resist stats are next to each other.
Thanks!  I made the change you suggested.
Why don't show both "Scores" and "Stats" in four rows instead of two? When I reviewd a match from GV cop together with a friend we're always switching them for every minute until exhaustion... :/
Can you make this available for other severs as well as NA?

Really nice work. Can't thank you enough for this :)

A few questions/ suggestions:

1. Is there any way to show more data about damage/healing to a particular target? I would love to be able to compare the damage I'm dealing/ taking vs my opponent to see how effectively I'm trading.

2. Along those same lines, how about data showing total and % health over time?

3. Is there any way you could animate the map? It would be really nice to be able to hit a play button and watch the match play out. 
3b. You might also want to add indicators to the slider at the minute marks to make it easier to just to a particular time.

1 & 2: Sadly not; the API doesn't return this information.

3: Sort of; unit positions are provided on a per-minute basis, and through some trickery I extract other unit locations through things like item purchases and champion kills.  The granularity probably isn't high enough to provide a satisfying animation.

On a side note, I've noticed that while the archangel's staff appears in the inventory, it's upgraded form doesn't show up. Just a quick bug that could use fixing. I think this also factors into the AP stat as well, so this may need to be looked at.
